data.title: Get Current Census Data for Carroll County, GA
data.meta_description: Need Carroll County demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Carroll County, GA from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 127,098 people, Carroll County is the 20th most populated county in the state of Georgia out of 159 counties. But watch out, Carroll County, because Fayette County with 123,351 people and Lowndes County with 120,712 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Carroll County racial/ethnic groups are White (68.3%) followed by Black (19.9%) and Hispanic (7.5%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Carroll County households was $66,895. Carroll County households made slightly more than Oglethorpe County households ($66,672) and Jones County households ($66,288) . However, 13.3% of Carroll County families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Carroll County residents is 35.2 years young.
